column4: How does one download a PPA package offline from a machine that doesn't have ubuntu?

on the ppa page, click 'View package details', then expand the package you want to download and they are listed at the bottom
I assume the .deb already includes the files, trism?
the debs are generally what you want unless you are rebuilding the package

dkms automatically rebuilds kernel modules when a new kernel is installed

packages.ubuntu.com , you'll also want to get the linux-headers package for your running kernel, since dkms will need it to build the module
